title: Ticket #6957: Schedd on Windows restarts with "fd_set is full" message
description:
A customer reports that their Schedd restarted with the message: 

ScheddLog fragment
SchedLog:
03/13/19 11:54:26 (pid:50392) Started shadow for job 360443.0 on <172.18.6.202:9618?addrs=172.18.6.202-9618&noUDP&sock=2848_48f4_3> for szymonk, (shadow pid = 24824)
03/13/19 11:54:26 (pid:50392) ERROR "Selector::add_fd(): read fd_set is full" at line 208 in file C:\condor\execute\dir_5536\sources\src\condor_utils\selector.cpp
03/13/19 11:54:26 (pid:50392) Cron: Killing all jobs
03/13/19 11:54:26 (pid:50392) CronJobList: Deleting all jobs
03

We believe that this is a bug specific to Windows, caused by a change to remove the 20% headroom that we used to reserve in the fd_set on Windows. This much headroom is not needed, since the fd_set is only used for sockets on Windows. But we changed the amount of headroom to 0, which appears to be causing problems because not all code in condor checks the limit. And also because we may need to account for the special socket we use to do WakeUpSelect.

We should change the FileDescriptorSafetyLimit on Windows to have a small amount of headroom, perhaps 10.
